result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael A. Svacina was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics (Fentanyl), a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).
  • Deliver Methamphetamine(<=3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)1.
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Sentencing memorandum
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 6, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Plea date on September 6, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Scheduling conference on June 30, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Attorney Thomas Erickson is appointed as counsel of record.  Defendant is to reimburse the county at a rate of $15.00 per month commencing 08-01-22.
Report from Public Defender indicating no attorney has been appointed yet.
Status conference on May 25, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Report from Public Defender indicating no attorney has been appointed yet.
Scheduling conference on April 25, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Report from Public Defender indicating no attorney has been appointed yet.
Scheduling conference on April 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Order to Withdraw
Motion to Withdraw.
It is hereby ordered that the defendant's motion to modify bail is denied for the reasons stated on the record.

09:43 AMDefendant Michael A. Svacina in court.  Attorney Ann M. Larson and Attorney Nathan Heim in court for Michael A. Svacina.  Attorney Jacalyn Christie Labre in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defense has filed a motion to modify bail as the defendant is unable to post the amount previously set. State objects to any modification.
The court feels that it would be a grave disservice to the community and too big of danger for the defendant to flee the jurisdiction. if bail is modified and therefore denies the motion to modify bail.
Attorney Larson indicates that there are significant conflicts of interest in this case and she will be filing paperwork to withdraw and a new attorney will be appointed through the Public Defender's Office.
Motion hearing on March 23, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Bail Motion.

2:30 PM Defendant Michael A. Svacina appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Ann M. Larson appeared by video for Michael A. Svacina in 22CF90, Attorney Jacalyn Christie Labre appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. 
The defendant has not applied for Public Defender representation in this file.

2:17 pm - Prosecuting attorney Jordan W. Feest appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Michael A. Svacina appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Carl Knepel appearing with the defendant, in person. Defendant still needs to sign up for public defender on this case.  This matter will continue to track with 22 CF 90.
Initial appearance scheduled for February 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Michael A. Svacina
Current: Manitowoc County Jail, Manitowoc, WI 54220   (Effective: 02-03-2022)
Prior: 820 S. 24th Street, Manitowoc, WI 54220
RE:  Deliver Fentanyl within 1000 feet of school, on 12-07-21.
Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of 2 counts deliver Methamphetamine within 1000 feet of school, 3 counts deliver Fentanyl and 4 counts felony bail jumping.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 02-07-22 at 1:30 p.m. Br. 2.  Bail is set at $10,000.00 cash with the condition that he not possess any controlled substances.   Bail not furnished and defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued. Copy filed.
Minutes.
